weka.classifiers.collective.lazy.ibk

Class Neighbors

  • java.lang.Object
    • weka.classifiers.collective.lazy.ibk.Neighbors
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable

    public class Neighbors
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable, java.io.Serializable
    This class associates all the "k" neighbors of an instance with the instance itself. It calculates the class for this instance (majority vote) and the rank. In case of ties the class label of the nearest instance is taken. As distance the euclidean distance is used.
    Version:
    $Revision: 2019 $
    See Also:
    getClassValue(), getRank(), Serialized Form

      whether to use the naive search, searching a list, instead of KDTree

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int compareTo(java.lang.Object o)
      Compares this object with the specified object for order.
      void find()
      searches for the neighbors
      double getClassValue()
      Returns the current class associated with the neighbors, i.e., majority vote, in case of a tie, the first class label.
      Instance getInstance()
      returns the instance the neighbors are determined for (returns the original instance, not having the missing values replaced)
      Instance getInstance(boolean original)
      returns the instance the neighbors are determined for, either the original one or the the one after replacing missing values
      int getKNN()
      returns the number of neighbors
      int getRank()
      Returns the rank of this neighbor, i.e., the difference between the number of instances with known class labels for the two class labels.
      boolean getUseNaiveSearch()
      Returns whether the naive search or the KDTree is used to search for the neighbors
      boolean getVerbose()
      Returns whether additional information is printed
      void invalidate()
      Invalidates the class and the rank.
      boolean isComplete()
      returns TRUE if the neighborhood has no more unlabeled neighbors
      boolean isUpdated()
      whether the class value was updated after the last invalidate() call
      void setUseNaiveSearch(boolean useNaiveSearch)
      Sets whether to use the naive list search (= TRUE) or the KDTree (= FALSE) is used for finding the neighbors
      void setVerbose(boolean verbose)
      Sets whether to output some additional information
      java.lang.String toString()
      returns the neighborlist in a string representation
      void updateClassValue()
      sets the class value of the instance to the one calculated, but only if the class value was missing

    • Constructor Detail

      • Neighbors

        public Neighbors(Instance inst,
                 int kNN,
                 Instances train,
                 Instances test)
        initializes the search, but the search still has to be initiated with find(). The extra call of the find() is only that other options can be set before the search is performed.
        Parameters:
        inst - the instance to find the neighbors for
        kNN - the number of neighbors to look for
        train - the training instances
        test - the test instances
        See Also:
        find()

      • Neighbors

        public Neighbors(Instance inst,
                 Instance orig,
                 int kNN,
                 Instances train,
                 Instances test)
        initializes the search, but the search still has to be initiated with find(). The extra call of the find() is only that other options can be set before the search is performed.
        Parameters:
        inst - the instance to find the neighbors for
        orig - the original instance before applying the ReplaceMissingValues filter
        kNN - the number of neighbors to look for
        train - the training instances
        test - the test instances
        See Also:
        find()

      • setUseNaiveSearch

        public void setUseNaiveSearch(boolean useNaiveSearch)
        Sets whether to use the naive list search (= TRUE) or the KDTree (= FALSE) is used for finding the neighbors
        Parameters:
        useNaiveSearch - if true the naive list search is used instead of the KDTree

      • getUseNaiveSearch

        public boolean getUseNaiveSearch()
        Returns whether the naive search or the KDTree is used to search for the neighbors
        Returns:
        true if the naive list search is used

      • invalidate

        public void invalidate()
        Invalidates the class and the rank. But the class only if the class label is not already set via updateClassValue()
        See Also:

      • getInstance

        public Instance getInstance()
        returns the instance the neighbors are determined for (returns the original instance, not having the missing values replaced)
        Returns:
        the instance for which the neighbors are determined

      • getInstance

        public Instance getInstance(boolean original)
        returns the instance the neighbors are determined for, either the original one or the the one after replacing missing values
        Parameters:
        original - if true, the original instance is returned
        Returns:
        either the original or the transformed instance

      • getRank

        public int getRank()
        Returns the rank of this neighbor, i.e., the difference between the number of instances with known class labels for the two class labels. E.g., 10 neighbors, 5 of class 1, 3 of class 2 and 2 unknown ones returns (5-3) = 2 as rank.
        Returns:
        the rank if the neighbor

      • getClassValue

        public double getClassValue()
        Returns the current class associated with the neighbors, i.e., majority vote, in case of a tie, the first class label.
        Returns:
        the current class label

      • isComplete

        public boolean isComplete()
        returns TRUE if the neighborhood has no more unlabeled neighbors
        Returns:
        true if all neighbors are labeled

      • isUpdated

        public boolean isUpdated()
        whether the class value was updated after the last invalidate() call
        Returns:
        true if the class label was updated
        See Also:
        updateClassValue(), invalidate()

      • updateClassValue

        public void updateClassValue()
        sets the class value of the instance to the one calculated, but only if the class value was missing

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(java.lang.Object o)
        Compares this object with the specified object for order. If this object has a higher rank than the given one, it returns -1.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
